test-set.name: construct-node
test-set.description: Tests instructions that create text, comment, processing-instruction etc nodes

source.content: <doc>In the world of XSLT, nothing is taken as granted.</doc>
<doc> <ch type="unknown"> my document </ch> <!-- This document has a valuable comment!! --> </doc>

test-case.description: Test "constructor functions"

test-case.description: Test "constructor functions"

test-case.description: Test "constructor functions"

test-case.name: construct-node-006
test-case.description: Test case that uses some of the String functions to create the text node.

test-case.name: construct-node-007
test-case.description: Test case to verify that in the generated comment node, the processor inserts a space after any occurrence of hypen that is followed by another hyphen or that ends the comment.

result.assert-xml: <out><!-- Testing the double - - --> <!-- Testing the single - --> </out>

test-case.name: construct-node-008
test-case.description: Test case to verify that any consecutive sequence of strings within the result sequence is converted to a single text node, whose string value contains the content of each of the strings in turn, with a single space (#x20) used as a separator between successive strings. Test case uses a sequence of literal text in the select attribute of an xsl:value-of instruction with a deafult separator.

test-case.name: construct-node-009
test-case.description: Test case to verify that zero-length text nodes are removed when they appear in a sequence that is used to form the content of a node.

test-case.name: construct-node-010
test-case.description: Test case that uses xsl:value-of to create text node while the value of the new text node is defined by the sequence constructor rather than the select attribute. Test case uses Literal text in the sequence constructor of an xsl:value-of instruction with a default separator.

result.assert-xml: <out> What happens if there is no select attribute?</out>

test-case.name: construct-node-011
test-case.description: Test case that uses the separator attribute on an xsl:value-of to separate adjacent items in the result sequence.

test-case.name: construct-node-012
test-case.description: Test of the default separator (Single space if using select or zero-length string when the content is specified using sequence constructor) on an xsl:value of for creating text nodes.

test-case.name: construct-node-013
test-case.description: Test case to verify that separators are never inserted between adjacent text nodes.

test-case.name: construct-node-014
test-case.description: Test case that uses xsl:comment to create two comment nodes.

test-case.name: construct-node-015
test-case.description: Test case that uses xsl:processing-instruction to create two processing-instruction nodes.

result.assert-xml: <out><?pi_1 Inside select attribute?><?pi_2 Inside the sequence constructor?></out>

test-case.name: construct-node-016
test-case.description: Test case that uses xsl:call-template inside an xsl:value-of, the called template itself uses xsl:value of.

test-case.name: construct-node-017
test-case.description: Test case to verify that when there are double hyphens in a comment, a space is inserted after the first hyphen.

test-case.name: construct-node-018
test-case.description: Test case using xsl:value-of to verify that Zero-length text nodes within the result sequence are removed.

test-case.name: construct-node-019
test-case.description: Test case to verify that Zero-length text nodes within the xsl:processing-instruction are removed.

test-case.name: construct-node-020
test-case.description: Test case to verify that Zero-length text nodes within the xsl:comment are removed.

test-case.name: construct-node-021
test-case.description: Test case to verify that the leading whitespace from the string value of a PI are striped.

result.assert-xml: <out> <?pi_1 Inside select attribute.?> <?pi_2 Inside the sequence constructor.?> </out>

test-case.name: construct-node-022
test-case.description: Test case to verify that If the result of evaluating the content of the xsl:processing-instruction contains the string ?>, this string is modified by inserting a space between the ? and > characters.

result.assert-xml: <out><?pi_1 What if we have ? >?><?pi_2 What if we have ? >?></out>

test-case.description: Test case that uses xsl:apply-templates inside an xsl:comment instruction to convert the source tree content into an output comment.

test-case.description: Test case that uses processing-instruction() node test in the match attribute of a template and use the content of the processing instructions as the value of new elements.

test-case.description: Test case to verify that there is only one text node created for the literal text.

test-case.name: construct-node-028
test-case.description: Test case to verify that for an xsl:comment instruction the text nodes specified in the sequence constructor are concatenated with no separator.

test-case.name: construct-node-029
test-case.description: Test case to verify that if the select attribute is present for an xsl:comment instruction the strings specified as its value are concatenated with a single space between adjacent strings.

test-case.name: construct-node-030
test-case.description: Test case using xsl:value-of inside and xsl:comment instruction to specify separator for comment text.

test-case.description: Test case to verify that the sequence is atomized inside xsl:value-of instruction.

test-case.name: construct-node-032
test-case.description: Test case to verify that the sequence is atomized inside xsl:comment instruction.

result.assert-xml: <out> <!-- my document This document has a valuable comment!! 1.2345679 P20DT3H--> </out>

test-case.name: construct-node-033
test-case.description: Test case to verify that the sequence is atomized inside xsl:processing-instruction instruction.

result.assert-xml: <out> <?pro my document This document has a valuable comment!! 1.2345679 P20DT3H?> </out>
